options.label: C
options.text: One molecule of amino acyl t-RNA

questions.text: If constitutive sequence of 4 nucleotides codes for 1 amino acid, how many amino acids can be theoretically formed
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • B) 16 – This option likely assumes that a two-nucleotide sequence determines the amino acid (4² = 16). However, the problem states that a four-nucleotide sequence codes for an amino acid, so this calculation underestimates the possible combinations.
  • • C) 64 – This number comes from the standard genetic code, where triplets of nucleotides (codons) code for amino acids (4 ³ = 64). However, in this case, the question specifies a four-nucleotide sequence per amino acid, leading to a total of 4 4 = 256 possible amino acids instead of 64.

questions.text: All of the following are true for genetic code except
There are 20 amino acids three codons, in spite of number of amino acids formed is 64 leading to that an amino acid represented by more than one codon is called
Cellular component of protein synthesis is
Which of the following enzymes participate in protein synthesis
Following is false for eukaryotic protein synthesis

options.label: B
options.text: eIF -2 shifts between GDP to GTP

options.label: C
options.text: Capping helps in attachment of mRNA to 40S ribosome

options.label: D
options.text: N-formyl methionine is the first tRNA to come into action

questions.correct_answer: D. N-formyl methionine is the first tRNA to come into action
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Option B: eIF-2 shifts between GDP to GTP – This is correct and therefore not false. Eukaryotic initiation factor-2 (eIF-2) is a critical protein in translation initiation. It forms a ternary complex with GTP and initiator Met-tRNA I , facilitating its binding to the 40S ribosomal subunit. After delivering the tRNA, eIF-2 hydrolyzes GTP to GDP, becoming inactive. For another round of translation initiation, eIF-2 must be reactivated by guanine nucleotide exchange factor (eIF-2B), which replaces GDP with GTP.
  • • Option C: Capping helps in attachment of mRNA to 40S ribosome – This is correct and therefore not false. The 5' cap (7-methylguanosine cap) on eukaryotic mRNA is essential for ribosomal recognition and translation initiation. The cap-binding complex (CBC) and eIF-4E help recruit the 40S ribosomal subunit to the mRNA, ensuring proper initiation of translation. This process stabilizes mRNA and enhances translation efficiency in eukaryotic cells.

questions.text: Which of the following statement is true ?

options.label: A
options.text: Identification of 5’ cap of mRNA by IF 4E is the rate limiting step

options.label: B
options.text: EF-2 shuttles between ADP and ATP

options.label: C
options.text: Eukaryotic ribosomes are smaller than prokaryotes

options.label: D
options.text: N-formyl methionine is the precursor of eukaryotic polypeptide synthesis

questions.correct_answer: A. Identification of 5’ cap of mRNA by IF 4E is the rate limiting step
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Option C: Eukaryotic ribosomes are smaller than prokaryotic ribosomes – This is incorrect because eukaryotic ribosomes (80S) are larger than prokaryotic ribosomes (70S). Eukaryotic ribosomes consist of a 60S large subunit and a 40S small subunit, while prokaryotic ribosomes consist of 50S and 30S subunits. The increased size of eukaryotic ribosomes reflects their higher complexity and additional regulatory factors involved in translation.
  • • Option D: N-formyl methionine is the precursor of eukaryotic polypeptide synthesis – This is incorrect because eukaryotic translation begins with methionine (Met), not N-formyl methionine (fMet). fMet is used only in prokaryotic translation, where it serves as the first amino acid in newly synthesized proteins. In eukaryotes, the initiator tRNA (Met-tRNA IMET ) delivers methionine to the ribosome without any formylation, distinguishing eukaryotic translation from prokaryotic translation.

questions.text: All of the following are true for amino acyl tRNA synthetase except

options.label: D
options.text: Attachment of amino group to 5’ end of tRNA

questions.correct_answer: D. Attachment of amino group to 5’ end of tRNA

questions.text: Aminoacyl tRNA is required for all except
Which of the following is an example of post translational modification
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Option B: 7-methyl guanosine capping – This is incorrect because 7-methyl guanosine capping is a post-transcriptional modification, not post-translational. It occurs on the 5' end of the nascent mRNA molecule shortly after transcription to protect the mRNA from degradation and aid in ribosomal recognition during translation.
  • • Option C: Poly A tail addition – This is incorrect because poly-A tail addition is a post-transcriptional modification as well. It involves the addition of a string of adenine nucleotides to the 3' end of the mRNA molecule, which is important for mRNA stability, transport, and translation initiation. It occurs after transcription but is not related to translation.
